Class ShipPlacementManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.battleship.controllers.ShipPlacementManager
public class ShipPlacementManager extends Object
Configure the event handlers (DragOver, DragDropped, DragExited) in the dashboard panel to enable drop-in/drop-out.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShipPlacementManager

      public ShipPlacementManager(GameController controller, BoardVisualizer visualizer, javafx.scene.layout.Pane shipsPane, double cellSize)

  • Method Details

    • setupBoardDragHandlers

      public void setupBoardDragHandlers()
      Configures drag and drop functionality for ship placement on the player's board. We handle three key interactions: highlighting potential placements during drag, validating and executing ship drops, and cleaning up visuals when dragging stops.

    • toggleOrientation

      public void toggleOrientation()
      Toggles ship orientation between horizontal and vertical placement. We update the orientation state and hide the current preview highlight, which will automatically refresh when the player moves their mouse. Called by GameController when the player presses the 'R' key.

    • makeDraggable

      public void makeDraggable(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas sourceCanvas, int size)
      Generic method to make a Canvas draggable. Makes a Canvas element draggable for ship placement. We configure both drag initiation (with visual preview) and cleanup after successful placement, giving players visual feedback throughout.
